*div1 type="summary"* *p*Branch T. Archer to Austin, April 22, 1832. Asking Austin's help at Saltillo in obtaining grant to improve navigation of the Brazos and collect tolls.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="04-22-1832">April 22d 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Colonel S. F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir, The variety of subjects, on which I desired conversations, previous to your departure for the seat of Government; and the little time allowed us, in the hurry of our interviews, one of the most important subjects, was neglected, or forgotten.*/p*
*p*Connected with the settlement of the *location_mentioned*new colony*/location_mentioned*, (without regard to the character of the settle [r]s, or the *location_mentioned*nations */location_mentioned*from which they may be taken,) the most important matter, is the improvement of the *location_mentioned*River Brasos*/location_mentioned*, (To say nothing, of the advantages, that must accrue to the present *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*on said *location_mentioned*River*/location_mentioned*,) This improvement, is of vital importance, to the great interests of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*we inhabit; and its accomplishment would give a new character, and a powerful impulse to its growth.*/p*
*p*If a grant can be obtained, by myself and company, to make the said improvements for reasonable tolls, the work shall be finished in two years, *location_mentioned*From the head of tide water to the Waco village */location_mentioned*for boats, of twelve feet breadth; drawing thirty inches water.*/p*
*p*With this reservation to the *location_mentioned*State*/location_mentioned*, that it may, at any time, after the completion of the work, possess itself of two thirds of the improvements, by paying to the *person_mentioned*company */person_mentioned*two thirds of the amount expended in making the same.*/p*
*p*You know as well as myself, the importance of the undertaking; and infinitely better, how to obtain the *location_mentioned*grant*/location_mentioned*, on reasonable terms. I will therefore confide its details to your management.*/p*
*p*Have the goodness to let me hear from you on this subject, before the *date_mentioned n="06-01-1832">1st of June*/date_mentioned*; as I shall start for the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned* at that time. Should the *location_mentioned*grant */location_mentioned*be obtained, I will bring with me the force to commence the work *date_mentioned n="Fall-1832">next fall*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*Connected with this business, *person_mentioned*six of us*/person_mentioned* have associated, to get a small steam boat, calculated to draw thirty inches of water, with an engine, of thirty five horse power, adapted to sawing timber on board the Boat.*/p*
*p*Nothing new in this *location_mentioned*neighbourhood */location_mentioned*since you left us.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*B. T. Archer*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Colo S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colonel Stephen F. Austin */person_mentioned* Mail *location_mentioned*Leona Vicario*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
